guide.title: Guide to vdr-overlay
guide.abstract: This document explains how to install software straigt from our testing overlay.

body.p: An overlay is simply the place where people put third party ebuilds. At gentoo these ebuilds are meant for testing, before putting them into the tree.

Layman (see their project page for more info), is one of the ways to emerge ebuilds straigt from an overlay. This can also be done for the gentoo-vdr ebuilds. Here follows the default way to get sources from repodoc:
Now you installed layman, you still won't be able to install sources. First you will need to tell the portage you want to use a local repo. This can be done with these simple commands:
body.pre: now we will touch a needed file. If it already exists it is alright. # touch /usr/portage/local/layman/make.conf # echo "source /usr/portage/local/layman/make.conf" >> /etc/make.conf
body.p: Generally, what you want now is to check out which overlays there are (layman -L). But since, we are explaning you how to use the vdr-overlay. We'll skip this.
By executing the command, layman will automaticly check out (svn co) the repository to /usr/portage/local/layman/vdr-testing/

Now you can start choosing testing-software from our overlay. Point your browser to http://overlays.gentoo.org/proj/vdr/browser/testing and choose a package. This package will be available through emerge.
